page.title: 05Employment
page.content: There is some work in our part of Southowram,the biggest employer being Marshalls in the south-west of the square.There they make reconstructed stone building bricks by crushing sandstone,then compressing it with cement into slabs and blocks.These products are sent all over Britain, and also exported.The sandstone is brought from nearby quarries.People who live outside the village,commute to work. Some local people work in this part of the village in the shops, pubs,clinic and school canteen.Most people work outside the village and travel to work by bus or car.Quite a lot of women used to work at Ingham's making sausages,but now it is used as a food store.There are some new houses being built but the builders mainly come from elsewhere to work.
